medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 10 days ago with vague abdominal pain. There has been no mention of fevers, chills, nausea, emesis, diarrhea, or constipation. The patient has experienced some bright red blood per rectum, which is considered normal for her due to existing internal hemorrhoids.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypercholesterolemia, hypothyroid, internal hemorrhoids, gallstones. Past surgical history includes thyroidectomy for suspected papillary cancer.
medical_history.family_history: Father died of prostate cancer; mother is alive with a history of breast cancer and lymphoma.
